intro: Aciotis olivieriana, commonly known as the olive daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers surrounded by white ray florets. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions. It has a fibrous root system and hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. Aciotis olivieriana is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
